title: Ronnie Cowan (rugby)
text:
Ronald "Ron"/"Ronnie" C. Cowan (born 26 November 1941) is a Scottish former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1960s and 1970s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for the <a href="British%20and%20Irish%20Lions">British Lions</a>, and , and at club level for <a href="Selkirk%20RFC">Selkirk RFC</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Wing">wing</a>, i.e. number 11 or 14, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a>, and at club level for <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> and <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Hull%20F.C.%20players">Heritage №</a>), as a , or , i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 3 or 4.
Background.
Ronnie Cowan was born in <a href="Selkirk%2C%20Scottish%20Borders">Selkirk</a>, Scotland.
Rugby union playing career.
Ronnie Cowan was capped five times for in 1961-62. He also played for <a href="Selkirk%20RFC">Selkirk RFC</a>. He went on the <a href="1962%20British%20Lions%20tour%20to%20South%20Africa">1962 British Lions tour to South Africa</a>.
Rugby league playing career.
Ronnie Cowan transferred to <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> during the <a href="1962%E2%80%9363%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1962–63 season</a>, and scored 119-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a> during his rugby league career.
International honours.
Ronnie Cowan represented <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a> (RL) while at Leeds, he was an <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a> in the 2-19 defeat by <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> at <a href="Knowsley%20Road">Knowsley Road</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Merseyside">St. Helens</a> on Wednesday 27 January 1965, to mark the switching-on of new <a href="floodlight">floodlight</a>s.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Ronnie Cowan played left-, i.e. number 4, (replaced by <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a> <a href="Les%20Dyl">Les Dyl</a>) in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 7-24 defeat by <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh</a> in the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20Challenge%20Cup">1970–71</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1970–71 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 15 May 1971, in front of a crowd of 85,514.
County Cup Final appearances.
Ronnie Cowan played , i.e. number 2, in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 2-18 defeat by <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> in the <a href="1964%E2%80%9365%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1964–65</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1964%E2%80%9365%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1964–65 season</a> at <a href="Fartown%20Ground">Fartown Ground</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on Saturday 31 October 1964, and played left-, i.e. number 4, in the 23-7 victory over <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> in the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1970–71</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1970–71 season</a> at <a href="Odsal%20Stadium">Odsal Stadium</a>, <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> on Saturday 21 November 1970.
BBC2 Floodlit Trophy Final appearances.
Ronnie Cowan played left-, i.e. number 4, in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 9-5 victory over <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> in the <a href="1970%20BBC2%20Floodlit%20Trophy">1970</a> <a href="BBC2%20Floodlit%20Trophy">BBC2 Floodlit Trophy</a> Final during the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1970–71 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Tuesday 15 December 1970.
Genealogical information.
Ron Cowan is the son of the rugby union and rugby league footballer for <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a>; <a href="James%20Cowan%20%28rugby%29">James</a> <a href="Jim%20Cowan%20%28rugby%29">"Jim"</a>/<a href="Jimmy%20Cowan%20%28rugby%29">"Jimmy" Cowan</a>, and the younger brother of the rugby union, and rugby league footballer; <a href="Stan%20Cowan">Stan Cowan</a>.
